<<<api>>>: Activity.setContentView
<<<code>>>: You can use the WindowManager class to set the size of the dialog. You can set the width and height of the dialog using the setWidth() and setHeight() methods of the WindowManager class. You can also set the layout parameters of the dialog using the setLayout() method of the WindowManager class.

For example:
```
WindowManager.LayoutParams lp = new WindowManager.LayoutParams();
lp.width = 800;
lp.height = 300;
getWindow().setAttributes(lp);
```
You can also use the setContentView() method of the Dialog class to set the layout of the dialog.
```
myDialog d = new myDialog();
d.setContentView(R.layout.my_view);
```
<<<explanation>>>: The WindowManager class is responsible for managing the windows of the application. It provides methods to create, show, hide, and manipulate windows. The setWidth() and setHeight() methods can be used to set the width and height of the window, respectively. The setLayout() method can be used to set the layout parameters of the window.

You can also use the setCancelable() method to make the dialog cancelable or uncancelable.
```
myDialog d = new myDialog();
d.setCancelable(false);
```
You can also use the setCanceledOnTouchOutside() method to specify whether the dialog should be canceled when the user touches outside of it.
```
myDialog d = new myDialog();
d.setCanceledOnTouchOutside(true);
```
It's important to note that, when you set the width and height of the dialog, it will be resized to fit the content of the custom view, if the content is larger than the dialog size, it will be clipped.
